lead_paragraph: The latest reshaping of the Italian lender will be closely watched for what it says about the willingness of investors to help troubled banks saddled with problem loans.

byline.contributor: Chad Bray reported from London, and Jack Ewing from Frankfurt.
byline.original: By CHAD BRAY and JACK EWING

headline.print_headline: Overhaul at UniCredit Is Viewed as a Barometer for Troubled Banks in Italy
headline.main: UniCredit to Cut 14,000 Jobs and Raise Nearly $14 Billion in Overhaul

snippet: The latest reshaping of the Italian lender will be closely watched for what it says about the willingness of investors to help troubled banks saddled with problem loans....
abstract: Italian bank Unicredit announces plans to cut 14,000 jobs over next three years while raising nearly $14 billion as part of strategic overhaul; move will be closely watched by industry as benchmark of how willing investors may be to help troubled banks in country.
